entry.title: Re: Can we "Define Screen Layout at Document Level" in S4...
entry.content:
Hello @sayooj123 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, item fields will not display simply because you've created a header field. You need to create and publish the field within the item business context and enable it for the target app UI.

Recommendation:-

Open Custom Fields and Logic (F1481).

Create the field under the item context: Business Context -Transportation Order: Items. Then, save and publish to complete the process.  SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields

In the same field, go to UIs and Reports and enable the field for the Transportation apps you use (for example, Manage Freight Orders. Save. SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields  

Go to the app, open a freight order, navigate to the Items area, and add the column via Table Settings or Adapt UI. Then refresh your browser session. SAP Help Portal-App Extensibility: Freight Order Management (Key User)

If anything is still missing.

Confirm the app supports item-level extensibility. Check App Extensibility: Freight Order Management (Key User). If the item isn‚Äôt listed, the page will indicate which parts are extensible. SAP Help Portal

Make sure you didn‚Äôt create the field in Transportation Order: Header by mistake. The header and item are in different contexts.

Avoid SAP GUI/Web Dynpro enhancements you may find online; those apply to on-prem/private-cloud TM. In Public Cloud, use the Custom Fields and Logic app only. SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Best Practice: Prozessstruktur f√ºr Logistik (Leergut-...
entry.content:
Hi,

also wenn man √ºber Best-Practice und Standards im Business Process Management (BPM) spricht, dann sind die ersten Stichworte:

  • APQC Process Classification Framework (APQC PCF): Prozess-Struktur die von einer Non-Profit Organisation entwickelt und herausgegeben wird (Helping Organizations Work Smarter, Faster, and with Greater Confidence | APQC)
  • Business Process Modeling Notation 2.0 (BPMN 2.0): Internationaler Standard f√ºr die grafische Modellierung von Prozessen (Business Process Model and Notation ‚Äì Wikipedia)

Die grunds√§tzliche Vorgehensweise in unseren Kundenprojekten ist, mit dem APQC PCF erstmal √ºber die Prozess zu sprechen, die ein Unternehmen eigentlich ben√∂tigt. Die Struktur und Klassifizierung aus dem PCF kann man in der Regel mehr oder weniger direkt in die Ordnerstruktur in Signavio √ºbernehmen. Dann kann man in Signavio mit BPMN 2.0 als Basis seine Regeln f√ºr die grafische Modellierung festlegen und letztendlich ans modellieren der relevanten Prozesse gehen.

Hoffe das hilft! Melde dich gerne wenn du mehr wissen willst üôÇ

Gru√ü,

Benedict

entry.title: External Source Document JV are not having the option of reversal
entry.content:
Dear all,

We have implement custom HR payroll in our system. Posting are happening correctly but we don't have the option of Reverse the journal entry. While posting the HR- FI journal entries there is no source documents or any journal entry voucher for reference.

Is there a way to reverse the Journal entry type External Source Document?

Thanks


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: External Source Document JV are not having the option...
entry.content:
Dear All,

Journal entry type "1847 - External Source Document" can not be reversed or cancelled once they have been posted. This is due to Legal reasons (Audit), and there is no original document created in the system for these entries.

The only way to reverse these posting is to create a manual journal entry with the offsetting entries. 

This scenario is explained in the KBA 3626309- Reverse Journal Entry Type '00107 - General Ledger Posting External System' Without Reposting https://me.sap.com/notes/3626309

Thanks.

Regards,
Anderson
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection Web...
entry.content: @Kranthi_1987, It should work, that's why you need to create a WADL file that tells DS how to read the JSON Response. Get the JSON Response and convert it into an XML and then conver that CML into an XSD and this XSD is the one that will contain the structure of the JSON response in XML format and this is what DS will use.

entry.title: Re: Automate PFCG process
entry.content:
Using the MENU_ADD_SERVICE does what i need it to.  I added SE16 to the Role Menu as 'Authorization Default'.

I generate the profile using function module PRGN_AUTO_GENERATE_PROFILE_NEW , and I have to set the ORG_LEVEL_WITH_STAR flag to 'X' to avoid a popup box saying Org Levels are unassigned.  After generating the profile, a lot of unwanted authorizations get added to the Role Menu, which we want to change to 'Inactive'.  I do direct table updates to tables AGR_1250 and AGR_1251 to set the DELETED fields to 'X'.  I know this is not recommended, but I can't find a method/function module that does it.  After setting these fields, the profile looks as it should in PFCG. 

When the user logs on, and uses SE16, they should be able to open the Transaction, but not be able to view the contents any tables.  As it turns out, they now have full access to SE16, with all tables available to them. I tried to regenerate the Profile after the direct table updates to AGR_1250 and AGR_1251, but that results in the S_TBAU_DIS and S_TABU_NAM authorizations changed from 'Inactive' to 'Active'.

Does anyone have an ideas on how to accomplish this?

entry.title: Re: Payments without boundaries: Embark on the future of payments with SAP Digital Currency Hub
entry.content: Africa, South Asia, and South America are the 'true mainstream emerging markets.' Their development path is not to follow North America's DeFi, but to start with more practical applications like Supply Chain Fi and PayFi. This is because these regions often lack sufficient traditional financial services, and blockchain technology can be of great use in these areas. These markets have not yet been 'priced-in' , but they possess immense future potential.

entry.title: Re: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content:
Theoretically, you could rerun the depreciation posting cycle for periods prior to the last posted period (provided they are open).

  • Depreciation Posting Run 
  • 2870963 - Depreciation run executed for a future period in transaction AFAB 

To be on the safe side, try this first in a sandbox or quality environment, then analyze the generated accounting documents.

Then, to prevent the users from skipping the period, make a custom logic in the FI Validation or only open required periods.

entry.title: RDDIMPDP Job gets deleted every hour
entry.content:
Hello, 

we have the issue that the Job RDDIMPDP gets deleted on the system after about 1 hour. We have in the TP-Systemlog the following error: 

So we schedule again with RDDNEWPP the job which works fine for a time frame not longer than 1 hour and the transports get imported fine during that time frame.

When we check in transaction SM37 the Job exist and is running fine the longest time about 1 hour.

So we waited until the time when the job is not more displayed an checked the systemlog transaction SM21 and found the following error which occures every hour, we have the same error on another system in the same transportlandscape but there no deletion of the job RDDIMPDP is done:

We will try to create the user in client 066 and see if it will help. We have created already in client 000 the user SAP_SYSTEM but that was not fixing the issue the job RDDIMPDP gets still deleted. Do you have any ideas how it could happen the the job RDDIMPDP gets deleted at the moment we run every 1 hour the report SE38 RDDNEWPP again so that transporting is possible until the RDDIMDP jobs gets deleted again.  We are not sure if the SM21 log entry we fround is realy cousing the issue. Do you have any ideas what could be checked to find out why the Job RDDIMPDP gets deleted on the system?

 

Thanks and Best Regards,

Daniel

entry.title: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for patient billing
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement from our customer who are into medical device manufacturing. The product is shipped to various clinics and hospitals for handover to the patients who are prescribed by the doctor. After the use for prescribed time the device is returned to the company for download of patient data. The invoice is raised after the patient data is downloaded by the company and shared with the clinic, hospital, patient themselves for the services as per any contractual terms (services is the report which is based on data downloaded from the device).

The device is serialized and the same device is used multiple times for different patients after which it becomes non operational and is disposed in controlled environment. (Since the company is FDA regulated)

My question to experts is as follows if someone has come across a similar scenario on any other project.

1) What would be ideal sales process for the product being sent to the hospital or clinic? (Consignment process? - May be too cumbersome for multiple hospitals or clinics to manage in SAP)

2) Once the product is returned back to the company for patient data download what would be the right process to keep track of the device which needs to be then used for a different hospital or patient for reuse? Any suggestions?

3) How to link the billing of the services (report based on download of patient data) with the device and the patient since the device was shipped to hospital or clinic (not directly to patient).

Any suggestion or pointers to any SAP documentation would be appreciated and helpful to find a suitable solution for our customer.

Thanks,

Kartik Shah

entry.title: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fiori in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
SAP learner here üëã

As I dig deeper into S/4HANA UX, I keep running into a pattern: even in organizations with a well-set-up Fiori Launchpad, a lot of experienced users still default to SAP GUI. I‚Äôm not trying to start a GUI vs. Fiori war‚Äîgenuinely curious about the practical reasons behind this and what has worked to shift habits

I am looking answers for the following topics: 

  • A concrete task where GUI wins (e.g., ‚ÄúDisplay/Change X,‚Äù ‚ÄúHigh-volume posting,‚Äù ‚ÄúMass edits‚Äù).

  • Why Fiori fell short (speed? feature gap? layout? navigation?)

  • Workarounds or fixes you‚Äôve tried

  • If you‚Äôve successfully moved teams to Fiori, what made the real difference? 

  • Which roles experience the biggest benefits with a switch from GUI to FIORI? Which Roles generally prefer to stay in GUI?

entry.title: Vendor Down-Payment with F110
entry.content:
Dear Sap-ers,

I have a request for a Customer of mine, to make a change in the Down-payment request payment - F110.

Currently SAP F110 makes a clearing of a DP request with Sp. G/L Indicator F and post on Vendor Account item with Sp. G/L Indicator A - as best Practice. The entry is posted with Document Type KZ (default figure in FBZP Customizing) - the setting is similar for normal Payments and Paid Downpayments to Vendors.

The clue is that the Customer uses SAP Analitic Cloud and due to data structure the Sp. G/L Indicator is not replicated for reporting  - and only Value to check different types of Transactions in AP for the SAC Report "Vendor Open Item" is the Document Type.

Do you know a way to make F110 clearing process to use a different Document Type for nomal items and different for Down-payments ??

I tried a Substitution - but it's not used during F110.

 

Any idea ??

 

Thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Re: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for p...
entry.content:
Hello,

I understand that you're placing the medical equipment in hospitals or clinic later this will be issued to patients for the treatment.

Are you charging the customer or clinics?

If you're charging the customer then is there a commission or any charges you pay clinics?

No, I don't charge the customer but charging the clinic on behalf of patient then, I recommend the below:

1. Create a equipment master and serial number, link it to your material master.

2. Sales order (assign the serial number) and process the delivery.

Note: I guess you will be delivering 100s of units to various clinics better option would be going for Consignment sales as this process allows to bring back to your plant.

I tried my best to understand your query and recommend the option I know üôÇ

Thanks

entry.title: Re: #Error getting last refresh variable for few users
entry.content:
What version of BusinessObjects are you using?

We are testing 4.3, SP4, Patch 13 and are finding the #ERROR message is appearing in places that work fine in 4.3, SP4, Patch 7.  Our fix is to correct the formula.  In our situation, the formula that is working in Patch 7 (it is surprising that it works in Patch 7) because it includes an "In()" context crossing two queries, one object from one query and one object from another query.  The two queries are MERGED but it is odd the developer did this in the formula.  Not sure why Patch 7 worked with this but fixing the formula to use objects from the same query in the "In()" context fixed our issue.

entry.title: ‚Äåüá¶üáπ‚Äå E-Invoicing Exchange Summit - Vienna
entry.content:
Roundtable Session:
Getting Ready for 2026: Challenges and Best Practices for Mastering Regulatory E-Invoicing in Belgium, Croatia, UAE, Poland, France, and Germany Across the SAP Business Suite

Date and Time
24 Sep 2025, 14.00 PM ‚Äì 14.30 PM CET

As regulatory e-invoicing mandates intensify across Europe and the Middle East, companies are facing a growing set of compliance deadlines and technical requirements. This roundtable session will bring together SAP experts to share practical insights on how to prepare for 2026.

Participants will explore country-specific challenges, integration strategies within the SAP Business Suite, and best practices for building scalable, future-proof compliance processes. The session is designed to foster open discussion, provide actionable guidance, and help organizations benchmark their readiness.

Speaker:
Olivia Vorstheim, Chief Product Owner, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Join us in Vienna to connect with peers, ask questions, and gain clarity on the evolving e-invoicing landscape.

Discover all the details and register now for the Summit.

Check out the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community.

entry.title: How to enable "Not Deductible" tax code for Supplier Down Payment Request in SAP ByDesign
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working with Supplier Down Payment Requests in SAP Business ByDesign. Currently, the dropdown for tax codes only shows Fully Deductible VAT codes.

 

However, in the Supplier Invoice module, I can see both Fully Deductible and Not Deductible VAT codes.

I went to Business Configuration ‚Üí Fine-Tuning ‚Üí Tax on Goods and Services, and tried creating a new tax code with the Not Deductible tax type. The problem is:

  • When I assign the tax type as Not Deductible, it does not appear in the dropdown for Supplier Down Payment Requests.

  • If I change the same tax code to Fully Deductible, it becomes visible in the Down Payment Request module.

Has anyone faced this issue before? Is there a way to make Not Deductible tax codes available for Supplier Down Payment Requests?

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks,

SAP Business ByDesign

entry.title: RE-FX lease-in contract management: advance payment for multiple rent periods
entry.content:
Dear community,

We are facing the following within our lease-in contract according to IFRS16:

  • The contract started on 01/01/2010, with rent 10K per month. Runs until 31/12/2043
  • On 01/01/2010, an advance payment to the rent was done. This advance payment runs until 2030. Thus, they don't expect AP postings nor interests triggered from the contract until 2030.

Let's say the contracts are going to be used as of 01/01/2026 in the system. Could you advise how we should set the conditions related to the rent and advance payment?

Many thanks,

Cedric

entry.title: Re: The limited no of documents in the Trial version of S...
entry.content:
Hi Mr. Nielsen,
Thanks for your feedback.
Free Tier and Trial allow you to process 50 documents in a rolling period of 30 days. Documents here are defined as pages, this means a two-page PDF file would count as two documents. 
(see https://help.sap.com/docs/document-ai/sap-document-ai/free-tier-option-and-trial-account-technical-constraints, https://help.sap.com/docs/document-ai/sap-document-ai/service-plans)

If you already consumed 47 documents, and you upload a five-page PDF, the processing would be rejected, since you would end up at 52 documents which would be above the consumption limit.

Could you point me to the documentation that says 30 pages, so that we can correct it?

Please note, that these free plans are currently meant for getting first experience with the capabilities, but for larger scale benchmarking, a paid plan is required.

I hope this explains the behavior, if you need support in a specific benchmarking project, feel free to reach out so that we can check how to support you best.

Best regards,
Tobias Weller

entry.title: WSDLs for SOAP APIs orderconfirmationrequest_in and orderrequest_out for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts!

Scope item 2EJ includes SOAP APIs for exporting purchase orders and importing order confirmations, deliveries and invoices.  When you go to the SAP Business Accelerator Hub (api.sap.com) and select SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition > APIs > SOAP you are able to search and find the documentation for the inbound delivery and inbound invoice, but the outbound purchase order and inbound order confirmation are not present.

The documentation for the purchase order and order confirmation (which includes the WSDLs) are needed in order to develop the BTP/Integration Suite iFlows to facilitate the exchange of these documents with external buyers.  If the documentation is not going to be listed on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, where is it able to be found?

entry.title: Re: LMS- Internet Link, Deeplink, Hyperlink in Item or Sc...
entry.content:
Found the answer myself: 

To add a hyperlink in an item description within the LMS, ensure that the HTML editor is enabled. Navigate to System Configuration and set "enableHTMLDescriptions" to true. After applying the changes, go to Learning Activities, access the desired item, and under the Item Details tab, click the translate icon. You can then add the hyperlink using the link and unlink icons. Save the changes, and the hyperlink will be visible in the item description when accessed by users.

entry.title: Custom field in EPPM WBS structure
entry.content:
Dear experts,

Our client has a requirment to have a field that indicates how far along a project or a WBS is. To meet thos requirement, we have created the custom field "Project Execution".

This printscreen shows how the custom field was created.

However we are facing two issues:

1 - The first issue is that we are only being able to record values, for this field, for the WBS elements not for the project. When we try to save values for the project, after saving, the field value goes back to 0.00.

2 - The customer also wants this field to show up in a custom report that we have built. However, for the column Project Execution, its rows are being filled in with the maximum value, which is not correct.

Best regards,

Francisco Costa

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial : Select Transport Request "No change recording enabled for package"
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently working on a SAP Fiori / RAP project in BTP Trial. I created an instance of type service ABAP Environment and a service key whose URL I entered in Eclipse IDE for the configuration of an ABAP Cloud project. The trial period having ended, I no longer have access to my package and therefore created a new instance and a new service key to recreate the backend of my project.

But nom, when creating a package, I can no longer select a transport request or create a new one and it is marked 'No change recording enabled for package'.


Moreover, if I still create the package and create tables inside it for example, certain database tables having the same name as my previous tables, eclipse displays an error message that there is already a table with this name.


How can I resolve the package selection issues preventing me from making the link between my back on Eclipse and my front on Visual Studio?

Thanks in advance !

entry.title: Re: Fetch sales order Number and Line item displayed on a...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To find the Sales Order Number and Item Number for an order displayed on the ‚ÄòDetailed Schedule Planning Dashboard‚Äô (SAPAPO/CPDS0), you can follow these steps:

  1. Access the Dashboard: Open the ‚ÄòDetailed Schedule Planning Dashboard‚Äô using transaction code SAPAPO/CPDS0.

  2. Identify the Order: Locate the order you are interested in. This dashboard typically displays orders based on scheduling and planning criteria.

  3. Check Order Details: Once you have identified the order, you may need to drill down into the order details. This can often be done by selecting the order and looking for options to view more detailed information.

  4. Use Smart Links: If available, use smart links or navigation options within the dashboard to access related documents or details. This might include links to the sales order or item details.

  5. Consult Related Apps: You can also use related apps like ‚ÄòTrack Sales Order Details‚Äô Track Sales Order Details or ‚ÄòSales Order Fulfillment - Analyze and Resolve Issues‚Äô to find more information about the sales order and its items. These apps provide a tree structure and process flow visualization that can help identify the sales order and item numbers.

  6. Contact Support: If the dashboard does not directly provide the sales order and item numbers, consider reaching out to SAP support or consulting documentation specific to your SAP S/4HANA setup for further guidance.

[1] S/4HANA with Embedded PP/DS Functionality
[2] Track Sales Order Details
Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: How to Add a Custom OData Field to a Smart Form in Fiori App F1511 using an Adaptation Project?
entry.content:
I need to add a new, mandatory 'Maintenance Plant' field (WERKS) to the create notification screen of the standard Fiori app F1511 (Request Maintenance).

The app's UI is built with Smart Controls (sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm), which rely on OData metadata to render fields. My goal is to make these Smart Controls recognize and display my custom field.

Backend Setup:
Our backend team has already extended the standard OData service for F1511. They have added the required WERKS field to the notification entity type. The extended service is now available as a new 'Z' service.

Frontend Attempt & The Problem:
I am using an Adaptation Project in Visual Studio Code to modify the UI of F1511. My process was as follows:

I created a new Adaptation Project for the F1511 application.

I attempted to make the application use my extended OData service by modifying the manifest.json file. I tried to change the uri of the mainService data source to point to my new Z-service.

Actual Result: This approach failed. The running application appears to ignore the change in the manifest.json and continues to call the standard OData service. Consequently, the metadata for my custom WERKS field is never loaded, and it does not appear as an available field in the Adaptation Editor's UI palette to be added to the Smart Form.

My Questions:
What is the specific procedure to make a Smart Form within a standard app (F1511) consume metadata from an extended OData service when using an Adaptation Project?

Is directly replacing the mainService data source in the manifest the correct method? If so, what could be preventing it from working? If not, what is the standard alternative (e.g., using annotations, controller extensions, or another manifest property)?

Are there any specific OData annotations (e.g., @ui.lineItem, @ui.facet) that must be added to the custom field in the backend metadata for it to be recognized and usable by the Smart Controls in the Adaptation Project editor?

My ultimate goal is simply to get the WERKS field onto the UI for user input. I am looking for the concrete technical steps to achieve this using the standard extension framework.

entry.title: Re: SAP project system
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To change a warning message to an error message in SAP, you can follow these steps:

Steps to Change Warning to Error

  1. Access Transaction Code SE91

    • Open the SAP GUI and enter transaction code SE91.
    • This transaction is used to maintain message classes.

  2. Locate Message Class CY

    • In the message class field, enter CY and press Enter.
    • This will display all messages under the CY class.

  3. Find Message Number 376

    • Scroll through the list or use the search function to locate message number 376.
    • This message corresponds to ‚ÄòPerson not found‚Äô.

  4. Change Message Type

    • Select the message and click on the ‚ÄòChange‚Äô button.
    • You will see options to change the message type from ‚ÄòWarning‚Äô to ‚ÄòError‚Äô.
    • Change the type to ‚ÄòError‚Äô and save your changes.

  5. Test the Changes

    • Go back to the CJ20N screen and test the network activity person assignment tab.
    • Ensure that the message now appears as an error, prompting users to input the correct employee name.

Important Considerations

  • Authorization: Ensure you have the necessary authorization to make changes to message classes.
  • Impact: Changing a warning to an error can impact business processes, so ensure stakeholders are informed.

By following these steps, you can enforce stricter validation on the person assignment tab in the CJ20N screen, ensuring users input correct employee names.

 

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Case Management in SAP Service Cloud Version 2 vs. Ticket Management in SAP Cloud for Customer
entry.content:
Many customers ask us how Case Management in SAP Service Cloud V2 differs from Ticket Management in SAP Cloud for Customer (or -as many call it- SAP Service Cloud V1). Case Management in SAP Service Cloud Version 2 offers a more comprehensive and flexible framework to efficiently handle various customer inquiries and case types. Designed with an AI mindset, it supports every step of the resolution process with AI-driven automation and insights. Additionally, it provides an end-to-end process flow integrated with SAP S/4 HANA Cloud and SAP BTP, ensuring seamless service delivery and extensibility. Let‚Äôs look deeper into some of these differences.

 

 

Flexibility for Your Business Processes
One of the advantages of Case Management is the flexibility it provides in structuring work processes. You can map case types directly to your business processes, allowing customer service teams to handle diverse inquiries‚Äîsuch as return processes, complaint handling, or invoice inquiries‚Äîeach with their own unique workflow. Whether dealing with simple or complex cases, this approach ensures that different processes are managed appropriately, guiding agents through the relevant phases and steps. This adaptability empowers service teams to efficiently navigate varied customer interactions, providing tailored solutions and improving the overall customer experience.

Easily set up different case types for effective resolution 
Creating and customizing case types in SAP Service Cloud V2 is both easy and intuitive, thanks to its user-friendly interface. Service admins can independently set up the phases and steps required for each case type without any assistance from IT. This empowers customer service teams to swiftly adapt to new situations and optimize their service processes.

Enhancing Agent Experience
Case Management in Version 2 significantly improves the agent experience by guiding them through the necessary steps of each service process, easing the onboarding of new team members. It also directs agents on what data to enter, simplifying the process and saving time. Furthermore, embedded insights and contextual data from knowledge management offer agents valuable information that aids effective issue resolution.

Smooth collaboration tools further enable service teams to work seamlessly with experts both within and outside customer service, ensuring comprehensive and timely resolution of customer issues.

Business AI Embedded Throughout the Service Process
SAP Service Cloud V2 integrates Business AI across the service process, offering a range of capabilities that enhance efficiency and effectiveness in case management. It begins at case creation, where AI assists in accurately defining the case type, ensuring inquiries are categorized correctly from the outset. As agents work on resolving cases, AI provides similar case recommendations, searching past cases for solutions to suggest, thus expediting issue resolution with informed advice. Additionally, Intelligent Q&A facilities are embedded to provide quick and relevant responses, further assisting agents in delivering timely service. These examples merely scratch the surface of the extensive AI capabilities embedded in the solution, all aimed at driving productivity and facilitating superior customer service outcomes.

Faster Resolutions, Better Agent and Customer Experience
In summary, Case Management in SAP Service Cloud V2 offers a transformative approach to customer service by reducing manual work, improving agent experience and accelerating issue resolution. This empowers service teams to adapt efficiently to diverse customer needs, leveraging flexibility, intuitive setup, and advanced AI capabilities. As a result, organizations not only enhance their service delivery but also foster stronger customer loyalty by consistently providing exceptional support. Embracing these innovations ensures that customer service operations are more agile, effective, and aligned with the demands of today's fast-paced business environment, paving the way for long lasting customer relationships driving high value for customers and the company alike.

Learn more:
If you want to see Case Management in action and hear about smooth transfer from SAP Cloud for Customer to SAP Service Cloud V2, here is a recent webcast with  that‚Äôs definitely worth watching:  Working with Case Management in SAP Service Cloud Version 2 - How to Prepare your Organization

entry.title: Re: Program to modify for avoid planned GI date update in...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To change the behavior of the planned Goods Issue (GI) date update in SAP S/4HANA, you can utilize the Configurable Parameters & Formulas (CPF) tool to define business rules that influence the sales order process at runtime. This allows you to maintain control over the pricing date based on your specific requirements.

Steps to Configure CPF for Pricing Date

  1. Define Factory Calendar Rules: S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility ‚Äì Determine Requeste‚Ä¶ - SAP Community Set up rules to determine the factory calendar, which will be used in the order process.

  2. Define Parameter Catalog for Pricing Date: S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility ‚Äì Determine Requeste‚Ä¶ - SAP Community Use SSCUI to define parameters that will be used to build the CPF decision table.

  3. Define Formulas for Pricing Date: Create CPF formulas to specify how the pricing date should be determined.

  4. Assign Custom Routines to Sales Document Types: S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility ‚Äì Determine Requeste‚Ä¶ - SAP Community Link the custom routine to the sales document type to ensure the pricing date is calculated according to your business rules.

  5. Test the Configuration: Create a sales order and verify that the pricing date is determined according to the rules you have set.

By following these steps, you can ensure that the planned GI date does not automatically update the pricing date unless specified by your custom business rules.

For more detailed guidance, you can refer to the SAP help documentation on flexible proposal of pricing dates.

 

 

 

[1] S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility ‚Äì Determine Requeste... - SAP Community
Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Transport Management available in SAP BTP Free Tier
entry.content:
Hi Shirley,

Thank you for your question and for pointing out the documentation - we‚Äôll update it to make this clearer.

To clarify: you don‚Äôt need a Free Tier plan for the cTMS service instance (the programmatic access), because the subscription appication-plan alone determines whether you‚Äôre on the free or paid version of cTMS.

This means, for the subscription, you choose ‚Äústandard‚Äù or ‚Äúfree‚Äù (depending on your commercial model), while the service instance plan always remains ‚Äústandard‚Äù (or export/transport_operator).

This also makes sense because you cannot fully use the service without a subscription and the associated UI access.

I hope this helps. Please let me know if you have any other questions.

Best regards,

Sven

entry.title: Re: Issue while loading maintenance order using LTMC
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

When loading a maintenance order using the LTMC template, you are encountering an error related to the operation number ‚Äò0010‚Äô being adapted by the system. This issue specifically occurs with the Reactive Order Type (YA01).

Possible Cause

The error might be related to the way the operation numbers are being handled in the template. In SAP systems, operation numbers should be formatted correctly, Error ‚ÄòThe requested data was not found‚Äô occurs in APP ‚ÄòFind Maintenance Task List‚Äô - SAP S/4HANA Cloud typically as ‚Äò0010‚Äô, ‚Äò0020‚Äô, etc., rather than ‚Äò010‚Äô, ‚Äò020‚Äô. This formatting issue can lead to errors during the migration process.

Resolution

Ensure that the operation numbers in your LTMC template are formatted correctly as ‚Äò0010‚Äô, ‚Äò0020‚Äô, ‚Äò0030‚Äô, etc. This aligns with the standard SAP formatting requirements and should resolve the error you are experiencing.

Additional Considerations

  • Verify that the template is correctly filled out and that all required fields are populated.
  • Check if there are any specific configurations or requirements for the Reactive Order Type (YA01) that might affect the operation number handling.

[1] Error 'The requested data was not found' occurs in APP 'Find Maintenance Task List' - SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: SAP Public cloud integration with third-party MES -ha...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

Integrating SAP S/4HANA Cloud (S4HPC) with third-party Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) involves several key processes, especially when Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) is in use. Here is an overview of how handling units are created and how goods receipt and consumption are managed:

Handling Units Creation and Goods Receipt

Handling units are integral to various logistical processes, Handling Units in Cloud Processes including production and warehouse management. In the context of S4HPC and MES integration:

  • Production Process: Handling units are created during the production process. The raw materials required for production are reserved and, if necessary, procured through purchase orders.
  • Goods Receipt: Once production is completed, the handling units are packed and confirmed as realized. The goods receipt is posted after verification from production.

Consumption and Process Order Confirmation

For consumption, the process order confirmation API can be used. This API facilitates the confirmation of production orders, ensuring that the consumption of materials is accurately recorded.

  • Process Order Confirmation API: Manufacturing and Supply Chain in SAP S/4HANA Cloud This API is typically used to confirm the completion of production operations and the consumption of materials.

Interfaces and APIs

The integration with MES systems can leverage various APIs and interfaces:

  • Production Order Confirmation API: Used for confirming production orders and recording consumption.
  • Handling Unit Management: Handling units are managed through specific APIs that allow for their creation, modification, and tracking.

For more detailed information on the integration processes and the specific APIs involved, you may refer to the SAP documentation and community resources.

[1] Handling Units in Cloud Processes
[2] Manufacturing and Supply Chain in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Purchasing currency in business partner.
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

Setting Default Currency for Business Partner in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the default currency for a supplier‚Äôs company code and purchasing organization data is typically set to the local currency Sourcing and Procurement - Default Options of the company code. This is a standard behavior and cannot be changed through configuration or user-specific settings.

Key Points:

  • Local Currency Default: When creating a Business Partner, the local currency of the company code is automatically used as the default currency. This is standard and cannot be altered without development.
  • Purchase Order Currency: If a purchase order with a different currency is assigned, the system will adopt the currency of the purchase order.

Options for Configuration:

  • No Standard Configuration: There is no standard configuration available to set a different default currency for the supplier‚Äôs company code and purchasing organization data without development.
  • User-Specific Settings: While user-specific settings can be adjusted for document currency in certain apps, these do not apply to the Business Partner creation process.

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Distribution of AVC-objects
entry.content:
Hello @Florian83 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up.

Avoid using Migration Cockpit for moving Variant Configuration (AVC) changes from DEV/TEST to PROD, as it‚Äôs only intended for initial loads.

In the quality system: Complete the AVC updates, including characters, classes, profiles, dependencies, and variant tables, then test and release a KB version.

Transport to Productive:

  • Key-user/AVC objects - Export Software Collection (Quality) - Import Collection (Productive).
  • CBC/SSCUI if there are any changes- Configuration Transport (Q-P).

In the productive run, consistency check and release the KB to activate the rules.

That‚Äôs the reliable, repeatable process. Migration Cockpit is not intended for continuous AVC deltas.

You can refer to the SAP below, supporting documentation

SAP help ‚Äì Export Software Collection: How to package and move key-user objects between systems. SAP Help Portal-Export Software Collection

SAP Learning ‚Äì Processing Transports in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Configuration Transport, Export/Import Collection, and when to use each. Learning.sap.com-Processing Transports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP help ‚Äì Available Migration Objects: migration objects are built for initial migration. SAP Help-Available Migration Objects

SAP Learning ‚Äì Defining Knowledge Base and Runtime Version release KB after import, so the new rules are active learning.sap. sap.com-Defining Knowledge Base and Runtime Version

With kind regards

Chuma

Where I‚Äôm stuck:

  • I don‚Äôt know the correct way to reference the CF-deployed HTML5 app so that it can be added to the list of authorized apps in my content package role.

  • Currently, it only works if I assign the app to the Everyone role, which of course is not secure.

My current package looks like this:
content-package/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ card/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cdm/

‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ content.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.json
The app I'm trying to access to

Question(s):
Is there a best practice for exposing CF-deployed HTML5 apps in a Content Package (CDM), so they can be authorized via custom roles? Has anyone implemented this workflow successfully? Any examples, documentation, or working patterns would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Re: Not able to trigger the approval flow for supplier co...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

Solution for Supplier Confirmation Approval Based on Price Variance

To achieve the requirement of triggering an approval process for supplier confirmations based on a price variance compared to the purchase order (PO), you can utilize the SAP S/4HANA Cloud‚Äôs flexible workflow capabilities. Here is a step-by-step approach:

  1. Define Workflow Conditions:

    • Use the ‚ÄòManage Workflows for Supplier Confirmations‚Äô Manage Workflows for Supplier Confirmations app to define the start conditions for your workflow. You can set conditions based on supplier, company code, purchasing organization, and document type.
    • Specifically, you need to define a condition that checks for a price variance exceeding 5% or $750.

  2. Implement Custom Logic:

    • Since runtime values for calculations are not directly available in the BAdI, you can implement custom logic using the BAdI ‚ÄòEnhancement of Flexible Workflow Properties‚Äô.
    • This BAdI allows you to define rules for agent determination and can be used to exclude certain agents from receiving approval tasks.

  3. Use BAdI for Agent Determination:

    • Implement the BAdI ‚ÄòProcurement: Agent Determination in Flexible Workflow‚Äô Procurement: BAdi for Agent Determination in Flexible Workflows to determine the approvers based on your custom conditions.
    • You can use the purchasing document number and workflow scenario as input parameters to fetch the necessary data for your calculations.

  4. Configure Workflow Steps:

    • Define the sequence of steps in your workflow, including the recipients and preconditions.
    • Ensure that the workflow step is marked as mandatory, so the approval process is enforced.

  5. Testing and Validation:

    • Test the workflow by creating a supplier confirmation with a price variance and ensure that it triggers the approval process.
    • Validate that once approved, the PO value is updated accordingly.

By following these steps, you can effectively manage supplier confirmations that require approval due to price variances, ensuring that the PO values are only updated post-approval.

Kind regards, 
Henrike

[1] Manage Workflows for Supplier Confirmations
[2] SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Flexible Workflow with new custom pre-condition for

entry.title: Re: How to Dynamically Change the Task Title in Workflow...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To dynamically change the task title in the Purchase Requisition workflow notifications, you can use custom logic by implementing a BAdI (Business Add-In). This approach allows you to define custom pre-conditions and step conditions that can include dynamic data such as the description or name of the Purchase Requisition.

Steps to Implement Custom Logic:

  1. Implement BAdI for Custom Pre-Conditions: SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Flexible Workflow with new custom pre-condition for

    • Use the BAdI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF to define new pre-conditions or step conditions.
    • You can specify dynamic data fields such as the Purchase Requisition description.

  2. Evaluate Custom Conditions:

    • Implement the BAdI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL to evaluate the conditions against the Purchase Requisition.
    • This BAdI allows you to check the values dynamically and set the task title accordingly.

  3. Configure Workflow:

    • Use the ‚ÄòManage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions‚Äô app to set up the workflow with the newly defined conditions.

By following these steps, you can customize the task title to include dynamic data from the Purchase Requisition, such as its description or name.

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Can 'Display Changes to Objects' be used to view the...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To view the scheduling agreement price change history in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you can use the ‚ÄòPrice Change Scheduling Agreements‚Äô feature. This allows purchasers to change a supplier‚Äôs prices in info records, contracts, or scheduling agreements, provided they have time-dependent conditions.

Steps to View Price Change History

  1. Access the App: Use the ‚ÄòManage Purchasing Info Records‚Äô app to access the scheduling agreements.

  2. Select Criteria: Enter the purchasing organization, supplier, and other selection criteria.

  3. Specify Price Change Type: Choose whether the price change relates to the gross price or a specific condition type.

  4. Define Validity: Set the validity period for the price change using the ‚ÄòConditions valid from/to‚Äô fields.

  5. Execute Changes: Initially, changes are simulated. To implement them, cancel the ‚ÄòTest run‚Äô selection and execute the program.

  6. View Changes: The old and new prices are displayed with the validity period. Save the changes.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation on ‚ÄòPrice Change Scheduling Agreements‚Äô.

If you are looking for a specific feature in the ‚ÄòDisplay Changes to Objects‚Äô app, it might not directly support scheduling agreement price changes as per the current options available.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Last Indicator Value in Line Monitor POD within SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hi @brunocechella 

Whenever an asset with indicators have been updated since they have been previously subscribed to via Last Indicator Plugin, it is required that the indicator metadata store is refreshed. 

Such changes include:

  • Adding new indicators
  • Removing indicators
  • Renaming indicators
  • Changing indicator datatype

The scenario experienced by you is likely the latter and a quick refresh should resolve their problem.

To refresh indicator metadata:

  1. Open any Line Monitor POD (or Custom POD containing that Last Indicator Value Plugin) in the POD Designer
  2. Navigate to the Last Indicator Value Plugin (Typically found in the Asset Details Page)
  3. Select the plugin and click on the Gears icon on the top of the screen to open its configuration properties
  4. Click on ‚ÄúConfigure Indicators‚Äù
  5. Click on the refresh button on the upper-right hand corner of the Configure Indicators dialog

 

Can you try the same and let me know ? 

 

Thanks,

Marcel

entry.title: Listpicker not showing selected values.
entry.content:
Hi,

I am facing an issue while trying to set selected values to a ListPicker. 

Scenario:

  • After clicking on ListPicker, user is navigated to list selection. User selects all values.
  • On the ListPicker screen all selected values are shown. User saves and applies filter.
  • When user navigates back to ListPicker screen, only the last item from ListPicker selection is shown repeatedly.
  • To make search work with both upper case and lower case words, a rule is added.
  • The above issue is not reproducing once the rule is removed from queryOptions.
  • Sample code attached for reference.

SAP MDK Version: 25.6.0-002

Please help.

Regards,

Girish
